snippet: Bill de Blasio has become something of a sensation in Italy, but the country has long been a singular force in shaping his life, and an identity he claimed as his family was falling apart.
abstract: New York City Mayor-elect Bill de Blasio, whose grandfather hailed from Italy, has become something of a sensation in the country, with many residents celebrating his victory; for de Blasio, Italy has long been a singular force in shaping his life and an identity he claimed as his family was falling apart.

byline.original: By GAIA PIANIGIANI and JAVIER C. HERNÁNDEZ
byline.contributor: Gaia Pianigiani reported from Sant’Agata de’ Goti, Italy, and Javier C. Hernández from New York.

lead_paragraph: Bill de Blasio has become something of a sensation in Italy, but the country has long been a singular force in shaping his life, and an identity he claimed as his family was falling apart.

headline.main: His Roots in Italy, de Blasio Now Has Fans There
headline.print_headline: His Roots in Italy, de Blasio Now Has Fans There
